page.title: 04Andrews' Primary School
page.content:
The founder of{Holybourne school} was{Thomas Andrews}who died in 1719.
In his will he left all his money and possesions for a free primary school to be built for boys{and girls.
It was the first school of its kind in Britain. The will allowed for 12 children from Alton, 5 from Binstead, and 3 from Froyle, as well as all the children from Holybourne to attend the school.
The poorest children at the school were also given clothing, shoes and all were given free apprenticeships in the area.
